title: Correspondence with Laver Regeneration and Bolsterstone Group

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please can I have a copy of all correspondence (emails, letters, meeting minutes) between the council and these two companies, from January 2015 to present:
- Laver Regeneration, formerly known as Arnold Laver
- Bolsterstone Group
Yours faithfully,
R. Downing

Thank you for your request for information relating to correspondence with
Laver Regeneration and Bolsterstone Group which we received on 13/02/2025.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt

Dear R. Downing,
Thank you for your request for information relating to correspondence with
Laver Regeneration and Bolsterstone Group which we received on 13/02/2025.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
The information you have requested is exempt from disclosure under section
12 of the Freedom of Information Act 2000. Sheffield City Council does
hold the information you have requested. However, we do not record the
information in a format that allows us to produce an electronic report of
this. Therefore, we would have to carry out a manual search of our
records. We searched the following domains: @laver.co.uk; @lavergroup.com;
@bolsterstone.com from 01/01/2015. We identified 4,821 (3.14GB) records
and we estimate that it would take 2 minutes to search each record.
Therefore, it would take us 160 hours to collate the information, which is
more than the cost limit of 18 hours or £450 specified in the [1]Freedom
of Information and Data Protection (Appropriate Limit and Fees)
Regulations 2004 (SI 2004 No. 3244).
Under section 16 of the Freedom of Information Act 2000, we have a duty to
provide advice and assistance to requesters. If you would like to narrow
down the focus of your request, we would be happy to process your revised
request as a new request for information under the Freedom of Information
Act 2000.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Sheffield City Council,
I would be grateful if you could offer me guidance into how I could best reframe the request in order to obtain as much of the information as possible, while bringing it below the cost limit.
I'm wondering what the 2 mins per record involves. Is it not possible to simply attach all the records and send them in bulk, rather than individually?
And what information are you able to filter on e.g. are you able to filter the records based on words that they include? This will help me narrow down my search.
Yours faithfully,
R. Downing

Dear R Downing
Thank you for your 14 March 2025 email.
You could reduce the time frame for your request; alternatively, you could
specify keyworks which we could search the Outlook servers within the
correspondence that we have identified.
The two minutes covers retrieving the information, checking the record is
in scope and not a hallucination; extracting and redacting information
(personal data; potentially commercially sensitive information).
We can’t download our search results and send them to you. We must ensure
the records are relevant to your request; that we comply with data
protection law; and that the information is disclosable “to the world”.
Please consider a specific aspect of the correspondence that you want to
receive and define it as specifically as possible.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear R Downing
I am writing in relation to your request for correspondence with the Laver
Regeneration and Bolsterstone Group which we received on 04/04/2025. We
apologise that we will not be able to provide a response to your request
within the initial timescale set out in our email of 16 April 2025.
Regulation 7(1) of The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 (EIR)
enables an authority to extend the 20 working day limit up to 40 working
days if it reasonably believes that the complexity and volume of the
information requested means that it is impracticable either to comply with
the request within the earlier period or to decide to refuse to do so.
In this case, we do reasonably believe that the volume and complexity of
the request makes it impracticable to comply within the 20 working day
limit, and consequently we are extending the deadline by an additional 20
days until 5 June 2025.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
